snippet: The Saudi-led military coalition bombed the clinic in Taiz, Yemen, wounding nine people less than a week after the medical group shared its coordinates.
abstract: Doctors Without Borders says it repeatedly informed Saudi-led coalition of location of clinic that was bombed during assault on Houthi rebels in Yemen; human rights groups claim coalition airstrikes have killed 2,500 civilians in conflict, and rebuke United States for its support of coalition.
lead_paragraph: The Saudi-led military coalition bombed the clinic in Taiz, Yemen, wounding nine people less than a week after the medical group shared its coordinates.

headline.main: Doctors Without Borders Says Clinic Hit in Yemen Was Known to Coalition
headline.print_headline: Bombed Clinic Says Coalition Knew Location

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
